page.title: 1875th ANNIVERSARY - GUIDES
page.content: 1985 saw the 75th birthday of the Girl Guide movement in the U.K.To celebrate this, the Guides and Brownies of the Harefield area attended a"Fun Day" at the John Penrose Leisure Centre, where the Harefield area hosted 400 Brownies of the Uxbridge division. Guiding began in the village in the 1930's and the late 1960's and early 1970's saw the greatest number of girls (ages 7 to 18) enrolled. In 1985 the numbers enrolled are 24 Guides, 68 Brownies and 7 Guiders. This represents a fall of approximately 45% since 1972. World wide, the Girl Guide Movement is as strong and as active as ever and is always ready to adapt its programme to meet modern needs.
